members.name: Sheikh Muhammad Abdullah
members.summary: Instrumental in Jammu and Kashmir's accession to the Indian Union. Served briefly as Prime Minister of Jammu and Kashmir. Critical negotiator for the terms of Kashmir's entry into the Indian Union, which granted it distinct status under Article 370.

members.name: Moti Ram Baigra
members.summary: One of only four individuals who served as constitution framers twice - first in the Constituent Assembly of India and later in the Constituent Assembly of Jammu and Kashmir. Former parliamentarian and Jammu and Kashmir state legislator.

members.name: Mirza Afzal Beg
members.summary: Demanded self-governance for Kashmiris and was elected to the Kashmir Legislative Assembly upon its creation. He was one of four members elected to the Constituent Assembly from Jammu and Kashmir.

members.name: Maulana Mohammad Sayeed Masoodi
members.summary: Kashmiri politician of the National Conference party and General Secretary for several years. Elected as member of the Constituent Assembly of Jammu and Kashmir. Made the first detailed speech in J&K Constituent Assembly.

members.name: Yashwant Singh Parmar
members.summary: Member from Himachal Pradesh in the Constituent Assembly. Contributed to framing of Indian Constitution as representative of the princely state region.

members.name: Maulana Hifzur Rahman Seoharwi
members.summary: Islamic scholar and General Secretary of Jamiat Ulama-e-Hind. Advocate for secular governance and constitutional safeguards for religious minorities. Actively participated in independence movement and brought Muslim community perspectives to constitutional deliberations.

members.name: Ajit Prasad Jain
members.summary: Prominent lawyer turned politician from the United Provinces. Former Union Minister for Rehabilitation and Food and Agriculture. Served as Governor of Kerala 1965.

members.name: Rai Bahadur Raghubir Narain Singh
members.summary: Prominent Delhi-based contractor and industrialist who constructed Imperial Hotel at Connaught Place and other major infrastructure projects. Major landowner and business representative contributing economic and industrial development perspectives.

members.name: Algu Rai Shastri
members.summary: Socialist member of Arya Samaj. Staunch Hindi supporter in the Constituent Assembly. Part of Rules Committee, Executive and Finance Committees and Planning Advisory Committee of the Lok Sabha.

members.name: Balkrishna Sharma
members.summary: Freedom fighter and poet known by pen name "Naveen". Member of 1st Lok Sabha from Kanpur and Rajya Sabha (1957-1960). Participated in Constitutional debates on titles, federalism and constitutional amendments. Awarded Padma Bhushan posthumously.

members.name: Banshi Dhar Misra
members.summary: He was an advocate, and Congressman of Lakhimpur-Kheri (U.P.); member of the Constituent Assembly; well-known Hindi writer.

members.name: Bhagwan Din
members.summary: Indian National Congress member from Uttar Pradesh; advocate for peasant rights and agrarian reform during independence struggle.

members.name: Damodar Swarup Seth
members.summary: Advocate for minority rights; active freedom fighter; served as a member of various socialist political parties

members.name: Dayal Das Bhagat
members.summary: Congress politician and social reformer from United Provinces; worked on community development and social welfare initiatives.

members.name: Dharam Prakash
members.summary: Rural development specialist from United Provinces with extensive experience in village administration and peasant welfare. Contributed perspectives on agrarian reform and federalism.

members.name: A. Dharam Dass
members.summary: Political organizer from United Provinces with background in local governance. Focused on constitutional provisions for regional autonomy and provincial powers.

members.name: R. V. Dhulekar
members.summary: Active freedom fighter; seasoned member of the Congress Party; educationist and advocate for social issues

members.name: Feroz Gandhi
members.summary: Indian freedom fighter, politician, and journalist; Author of the Parliamentary Proceedings Act which allowed the media to publicize parliamentary proceedings; husband to former PM Indira Ghandi.

members.name: Gopal Narain
members.summary: Associated with Pandit Nehru's political circle; intellectual and lawyer from Uttar Pradesh; advocate for modern democratic principles.

members.name: Krishna Chandra Sharma
members.summary: Held key posts in the Congress; Remained lifelong member of the Party. After independence, elected to both the first and second Lok Sabha.

members.name: Govind Ballabh Pant
members.summary: Eminent Freedom Fighter from Kumaon, First Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh

members.name: Govind Malviya
members.summary: An Indian freedom fighter, educationist, and politician; he spoke on issues such as the election of the President, periodical review of the Constitution, and reservations.

members.name: Har Govind Pant
members.summary: Journalist and lawyer advocating for awareness around political movements for Independence; Deputy Speaker of the UP Legislature

members.name: Harihar Nath Shastri
members.summary: Well known for contributions to the Uttar Pradesh labor movement; involved in the freedom movement since a young age.

members.name: Hriday Nath Kunzru
members.summary: Two-time member of the Rajya Sabha; Member of the States Reorganisation Commission and the University Grants Commission

members.name: Jaspat Roy Kapoor
members.summary: Indian politician and active participant during the Assembly debates.

members.name: Jagannath Baksh Singh
members.summary: Thakur (landed aristocrat) from United Provinces; represented traditional Rajput leadership transitioning to democratic governance.

members.name: Jawaharlal Nehru
members.summary: India's first Prime Minister; shaped India's early foreign policy; a key leader of the Indian National Congress and the Independence movement

members.name: Jogendra Singh
members.summary: Labor movement activist from United Provinces with experience organizing workers and agricultural laborers. Advocated for labor rights and social security provisions.

members.name: Jugal Kishore
members.summary: Trade union organizer and labor leader representing working class interests. Contributed to constitutional discussions on labor standards, working conditions, and workers compensation.

members.name: Jwala Prasad Srivastava
members.summary: Knighted by the British in 1934; a British loyalist and one of Kanpur's leading industrialists; involved with the Hindu Mahasabha

members.name: B. V. Keskar
members.summary: India's longest serving Minister for Information and Broadcasting. Promoted classical music on All India Radio but banned Hindi film music, cricket commentaries, and the harmonium from it.

members.name: Kamla Chaudhry
members.summary: Freedom fighter and a pioneer of woman's rights who consistently worked for the improvement of women's lives in the society. She was an elected member to the Constituent Assembly of India.

members.name: Kamalapati Tripathi
members.summary: Freedom fighter and a senior leader of the Indian National Congress who was also a writer, journalist and an eminent politician.

members.name: J. B. Kripalani
members.summary: A formidable educationist, active freedom fighter and Gandhian; advocated for socialism and upholding fundamental rights

members.name: Mahavir Tyagi
members.summary: Prominent Gandhian activist and social reformer; Opposed preventive detention and suspension of Fundamental Rights in Emergency situations

members.name: Khurshed Lal
members.summary: Deputy Minister for Communications (State) in India's first cabinet after independence. Part of the Constituent Assembly's Select Committee that had the task of evaluating the Hindu Code Bill and reporting on it.

members.name: Masuriya Din
members.summary: Veteran of independence struggle from United Provinces with grassroots organizing experience. Brought perspectives from common people to constitutional formation.

members.name: Mohanlal Saksena
members.summary: Minister of Rehabilitation between 1948-50; active leader within the Indian National Congress; lawyer and journalist

members.name: Padampat Singhania
members.summary: Textile industry magnate and founder of major cotton mills in United Provinces. Represented industrial and business community interests in constitutional economic policy discussions.

members.name: Phool Singh
members.summary: Social activist and community organizer from United Provinces. Experienced in welfare programs and community development activities.

members.name: Paragi Lal
members.summary: Local administrator from United Provinces with experience in district governance and revenue administration. Contributed to constitutional provisions on state administration.

members.name: Purnima Banerjee
members.summary: One of the 15 women members of the Constituent Assembly. Member of both the Congress and the Congress Socialist Party.

members.name: Purushottam Das Tandon
members.summary: Freedom Fighter, Hindi Advocate, Given Title of 'Rajarshi'

members.name: Hira Vallabha Tripathi
members.summary: Educator and school administrator from United Provinces. Advocated for education as fundamental right and contributed to educational policy provisions.

members.name: Ram Chandra Gupta
members.summary: Congress member and legal scholar from Uttar Pradesh; specialized in property rights and administrative law.

members.name: Shibban Lal Saxena
members.summary: Landlord and social reformer from United Provinces with background in rural administration. Focused on agrarian relations and land reform discussions.

members.name: Satish Chandra
members.summary: Former Parliamentary Secretary to Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru in 1951. Member of several important national committees for food grains, railways, and scientific research.

members.name: John Matthai
members.summary: One of the architects of the Bombay Plan; reputed academic; former Vice-Chancellor of Bombay and Kerala University

members.name: Sucheta Kripalani
members.summary: Gandhi's disciple and freedom fighter who participated in Quit India Movement. One of 15 women members of Constituent Assembly. Sang Vande Mataram before Nehru's Independence speech. Later became India's first female Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh (1963-1967).

members.name: Sunder Lall
members.summary: Independence activist (1923–1987) from Saharanpur; served six terms in Lok Sabha (1952-1977) representing Saharanpur/Haridwar; key Congress figure associated with Indira Gandhi era.

members.name: Venkatesh Narayan Tiwari
members.summary: Venkatesh Narayan Tivary (1890â€“1965) was an Indian journalist, freedom fighter, and politician associated with the Indian National Congress. He was a prominent public intellectual in the early years of independent India, playing significant roles in the Constituent Assembly, the first Lok Sabha, and various government committees.

members.name: Mohanlal Gautam
members.summary: He was the general secretary, U.P.P.C.C., 1930-31, and secretary, 1936 and 1963-64; imprisoned several times during the freedom movement; secretary of the Congress Socialist Party, 1934; member, Constituent Assembly; General Secretary, A.I.C.C., 1950- 51; Minister, U.P., 1952-54 and 1957-60; member, Rajya Sabha, 1969-1972. Minister for Cooperation, Agriculture and Animal Husbandry in the UP Government.

members.name: Vishwambhar Dayal Tripathi
members.summary: Educational administrator and intellectual from United Provinces. Contributed to constitutional philosophy on governance and institutional design.

members.name: Vishnu Sharan Dublish
members.summary: Publisher and journalist from United Provinces. Brought perspectives on press freedom and information policy to constitutional discussions.

members.name: Begum Aizaz Rasul
members.summary: Only Muslim woman to be a member of the Constituent Assembly of India.

members.name: Hyder Hussain
members.summary: Member of the Provisional Parliament and first Lok Sabha in 1952; founded the Rotary Club in Lucknow

members.name: Hasrat Mohani
members.summary: Founding Member of the Communist Part of India; A noted Urdu poet well-known for coining the slogan, 'Inquilab Zindabad'.

members.name: Abul Kalam Azad
members.summary: A prominent member of the Congress Party and the first education minister of independent India.

members.name: Nawab Mohammad Ismail Khan
members.summary: Eminent politician and activist from the Muslim League; member of the founding committee of Jamia Milia Islamia University

members.name: Rafi Ahmad Kidwai
members.summary: One of the foremost leaders of the Indian National Congress; active freedom fighter; the first Communications Minister

members.name: Z H Lari
members.summary: Muslim community leader from United Provinces States. Advocated for constitutional protections for religious and linguistic minorities.

members.name: Chaudhry Khaliquzzaman
members.summary: Prominent Muslim League politician, later migrated to Pakistan. Former Mayor of Lucknow and President of Muslim League

members.name: Bashir Hussain Zaidi
members.summary: Not an active member of the Assembly but supported uplifting minority communities, in particular the Muslim minority and the importance of democracy.

members.name: Krishna Singh
members.summary: Administrator from United Provinces States with expertise in state governance and institutional frameworks.

members.name: Bakshi Tek Chand
members.summary: Former Chief Justice of the Lahore High Court; Played a key role in public life during Partition.

members.name: Jairamdas Daulatram
members.summary: Former governor of Bihar and Assam; first Minister of Agriculture; passionate advocate for Sindhi language and community.

members.name: Thakur Das Bhargava
members.summary: Senior intellectual and freedom fighter from Punjab. Contributed significantly to discussions on fundamental rights, civic freedoms, and constitutional structure.

members.name: Bikramlal Sondhi
members.summary: Born in 1900, Bikram Lal Sondhi got his B.Sc (Hons) degree from Panjab University. He was imprisoned for participating in the Quit India Movement and underwent imprisonment at Dalhousie and Lahore. Hailing from Jalandhar City, Sondhi was Investment and Finance Advisor to various organisations.

members.name: Yashwant Rai
members.summary: Regional political figure from Punjab with administrative background. Focused on provincial powers and agricultural development.

members.name: Ranbir Singh Hooda
members.summary: Politician; One of the leaders responsible for leading the Satyagraha and Quit India movement in Rohtak, Haryana.

members.name: Lala Achint Ram
members.summary: A key leader in Gopal Krishna Gokhale's Servants of India Society. Held several significant administrative positions in Punjab Congress.

members.name: Nand Lal
members.summary: Social welfare advocate from Punjab with experience in community development. Participated in discussions on welfare provisions.

members.name: Baldev Singh
members.summary: Represented the Sikh community in the negotiations with the Cripps Mission and Cabinet Mission. First Defence Minister of independent India. In-charge of security and relief efforts during partition.

members.name: Giani Gurmukh Singh Musafir
members.summary: Indian politician and Punjabi writer; former Chief Minister of Punjab.

members.name: Sardar Hukam Singh
members.summary: First Sikh to be elected as Speaker in the Lok Sabha and former Governor of Rajasthan; launched an English language journal called 'The Spokesman'.

members.name: Sardar Bhopinder Singh Mann
members.summary: Sikh community leader from Punjab. Advocated for religious freedom, minority rights, and constitutional safeguards for faith communities.

members.name: Sardar Rattan Singh Lohgarh
members.summary: Military officer (1920 - 2006) and freedom fighter from Punjab; later held ministerial portfolios in Punjab government.

members.name: Sardar Partap Singh Kairon
members.summary: Distinguished Sikh freedom fighter and administrator from Punjab. Later served as Chief Minister of Punjab (1956-1964). Major contributor to constitutional provisions on state governance and federalism.

members.name: Chaudhry Suraj Mal
members.summary: Jat community leader and agricultural expert from Punjab; strong advocate for peasant and rural welfare.

members.name: Begum Aizaz Rasul
members.summary: Only Muslim woman to be a member of the Constituent Assembly of India.

members.name: Ranjit Singh
members.province: Patiala and East Punjab States Union
members.summary: Administrator from Patiala and East Punjab States Union. Represented princely states in discussing integration, governance mechanisms, and state powers.

members.name: Sochet Singh Aujla
members.province: Patiala and East Punjab States Union
members.summary: Regional leader from East Punjab States. Participated in discussions on state integration and administrative coordination.

members.name: Bhagwant Roy
members.province: Patiala and East Punjab States Union
members.summary: Part of the All India Students Federation and member of its Working Committee in 1937. Spoke in favour of the rights of the people of the Princely States in the Constituent Assembly.

members.name: Deshbandhu Gupta
members.summary: Freedom Fighter and Socialist Politician endearingly called 'Deshbandhu', he supported uplifting Dalits and the removal of untouchability; participated in the Quit India Movement and he was influential on Indian journalism as well.

members.name: V. T. Krishnamachari
members.summary: Eminent administrator and vice-chairman of Constituent Assembly from Rajputana. Pioneer of panchayati raj system and later founder of Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad.

members.name: Hiralal Shastri
members.summary: An Indian politician and the first Chief Minister of Rajasthan;

members.name: Sardar Singhjhi of Khetri
members.summary: Ruler of princely state of Khetri. Represented royal and princely state interests in constitutional discussions on integration and governance.

members.name: Jaswant Singhji
members.summary: Rajput prince from Bikaner; represented princely state interests in national integration process.

members.name: Raj Bhadur
members.summary: Rajput political leader from Rajputana region. Participated in state integration and constitutional framework design.

members.name: Manikya Lal Varma
members.summary: Intellectual and administrator from Rajputana. Contributed to constitutional theory and governance structures.

members.name: Gokul Lal Asava
members.summary: Political leader from Rajputana. Represented regional interests in state integration and governance discussions.

members.name: Ramchandra Upadhyaya
members.summary: Scholar and educator from Rajputana; advocate for classical Indian learning combined with modern education.

members.name: Balwant Singh Mehta
members.summary: Key congress leader in Rajasthan; was a member of many caste based organisations and an editor for cultural magazines.

members.name: Dalel Singh
members.summary: Community organizer from Rajputana focused on social welfare and development.

members.name: Jainarain Vyas
members.summary: Former Chief Minister of Rajasthan and leader of Indian National Congress party.

members.name: Mukut Bihari Lal Bhargava
members.summary: Eminent Lawyer; Former Senior Advocate in the Supreme Court. Influential political personality from Ajmer; Three time Lok Sabha member from the Ajmer Constituency

members.name: Amiyo Kumar Ghosh
members.summary: Freedom fighter and educationist from Bihar. Participated in independence struggle and brought education policy expertise to constitutional formation.

members.name: Anugrah Narayan Sinha
members.summary: Popularly known as 'Bihar Vibhuti', an ardent Gandhi follower, and influential in shaping the political landscape of Bihar.

members.name: Banarsi Prasad Jhunjhunwala
members.summary: Industrial entrepreneur from Bihar. Founded business enterprises and represented industrial community in economic policy discussions.

members.name: Bhagwat Prasad
members.summary: Freedom fighter from Bihar and veteran of civil disobedience movements; received national recognition for independence struggle.

members.name: Boniface Lakra
members.summary: Tribal community leader from Bihar. Specifically advocated for scheduled tribes provisions, forest rights, and tribal welfare measures.

members.name: Brajeshwar Prasad
members.summary: Indian politician and lawyer; involved in the Quit India Movement.

members.name: Chandrika Ram
members.summary: Leading figure in the depressed classes movement in Bihar; Served significant administrative positions in the Bihar and all-India Depressed Classes League.

members.name: K. T. Shah
members.summary: Eminent economist, advocate and writer; An important socialist face in the Constituent Assembly.

members.name: Devendra Nath Samanta
members.summary: Academic administrator from Bihar. Contributed to constitutional provisions on governance structure and institutional design.

members.name: Dip Narain Sinha
members.summary: Rural administrator from Bihar with expertise in agrarian development and village governance.

members.name: Guptanath Singh
members.summary: Social welfare worker from Bihar. Focused on provisions for backward classes and social security measures.

members.name: Jadubans Sahay
members.summary: Bihar-based freedom fighter; often recognized as unsung hero of independence movement; worked on educational advancement.

members.name: Jagat Narain Lal
members.summary: Former Hindu Mahasabha Member who later joined Congress

members.name: Jagjivan Ram
members.summary: Prominent Dalit Freedom fighter, Independent India's first Labour Minister.

members.name: Jaipal Singh Munda
members.summary: Prominent Adivasi member and indigenous rights activist.

members.name: Kameshwar Singh
members.summary: Independent member from Bihar, Maharaja of Darbhanga, Prominent Zamindar

members.name: Kamaleshwari Prasad Yadav
members.summary: Rural administrator from Bihar representing peasant and agricultural interests.

members.name: Mahesh Prasad Sinha
members.summary: Educator from Bihar. Contributed expertise on education, cultural preservation, and language policy.

members.name: Krishna Ballabh Sahay
members.summary: Spearheaded the anti-colonial movement in Bihar. Earned the title 'Iron Man of Bihar' for his strong opposition to the Zamindari system. Responsible for the passage of the Zamindari Abolition Bill in the State.

members.name: Raghunandan Prasad
members.summary: Freedom fighter from Bihar with organizing background. Brought perspectives from independence struggle to constitutional formation.

members.name: Rajendra Prasad
members.summary: Served as the President of the Constituent Assembly and Chairman of four Assembly Committees. Later elected First President of independent India.

members.name: Rameshwar Prasad Sinha
members.summary: Lawyer and legislator from Bihar. Legal expertise in constitutional provisions on judiciary, courts, and legal rights.

members.name: Ramnarayan Singh
members.summary: Dedicated Congress Party political worker, prominent freedom fighter titled 'Chotanagpur kesri', devoted Gandhian

members.name: Sachchidananda Sinha
members.summary: Key role in the formation of the Province of Bihar and Orissa. Prominent academic who published a number of papers and books.

members.name: Sarangdhar Sinha
members.summary: Active participant in independence movement and civil disobedience; legal professional and social reformer from Bihar.

members.name: Satyanarayan Sinha
members.summary: Prominent Congress member and Chief Whip of the Party. Former Minister of Parliamentary Affairs, Information and Broadcasting, and Parliamentary Affairs and Communications.

members.name: Binodanand Jha
members.summary: An Indian Politician and former Chief Minister from Bihar.

members.name: P. K. Sen
members.summary: Academic from Bihar. Intellectual contributor to constitutional philosophy and theoretical framework.

members.name: Sri Krishna Sinha
members.summary: The first Chief Minister of Bihar and a prominent member of the Constituent Assembly who raised his voice against the caste system and supported the oppressed.

members.name: Sri Narayan Mahtha
members.summary: Religious scholar and community leader from Bihar. Advocated for religious freedom and cultural preservation provisions.

members.name: Shyam Nandan Prasad Mishra
members.summary: Landlord and rural administrator from Bihar representing agrarian interests.

members.name: Hussain Imam
members.summary: Hailing from Gaya, Bihar and a senior leader of the All-India Muslim League, He served in the Council of State (1930â€“1936) and later sat in the Constituent Assembly of India (1946â€“1951) as a Muslim League member from Bihar. In September 1951 Hussain Imam migrated to Pakistan and was appointed the first Chairman of the House Building Finance Corporation (established 1952), tasked with providing housing loans in the new state.

members.name: Syed Jaffer Imam
members.summary: Muslim intellectual from Bihar. Strongly advocated for secular constitutional framework and religious minority protections.

members.name: S. M. Latifur Rahman
members.summary: Muslim community leader from Bihar. Represented community interests in discussions on minority safeguards.

members.name: Mohd Tahir Hussain
members.summary: Islamic scholar from Bihar. Contributed to constitutional provisions on religious freedom and interfaith harmony.

members.name: Tajamul Hussain
members.summary: Political leader from Bihar advocating secular governance. Focused on communal harmony and minority rights provisions.

members.name: Choudhry Abid Hussain
members.summary: Lawyer from Bihar with constitutional law expertise. Contributed to fundamental rights and judicial provisions.

members.name: Hargovind Mishra
members.summary: Social reformer from Bihar. Advocated for welfare provisions and social justice in constitutional framework.

members.name: Himmat Singh K. Maheshwari
members.summary: Political leader from princely state of Cooch Behar. Represented hill state interests in integration and governance discussions.

members.name: Mono Mohan Das
members.summary: Practicing doctor at Calcutta Medical College. Part of Subash Chandra Bose's Forward Bloc. Held several important posts in the Education and Scientific Research Ministries post-independence.

members.name: Dr. B. R. Ambedkar
members.summary: Father of the Indian Constitution, Eminent Scholar and Social Reformer, Renounced Hinduism to adopt Navayana Buddhism

members.name: Arun Chandra Guha
members.summary: An author, editor, and politician; ran his own publishing company called 'Saraswati Library' through which he published radical writings.

members.name: Lakshmi Kanta Maitra
members.summary: Secretary of The Congress Nationalist Party and an eminent politician who was elected to the Constituent Asembly from Calcutta.

members.name: Mihir Lal Chattopadhyay
members.summary: Intellectual and writer from Bengal. Contributed cultural and literary perspectives to constitutional formation.

members.name: Satis Chandra Samanta
members.summary: Educator from Bengal with school administration background. Focused on education as fundamental right.

members.name: Suresh Chandra Majumdar
members.summary: Lawyer from Bengal. Legal expertise in constitutional provisions on rights, judiciary, and legal framework.

members.name: Upendranath Barman
members.summary: Administrator from Bengal with bureaucratic expertise. Contributed to constitutional provisions on civil service and administration.

members.name: Prabhudayal Himatsingka
members.summary: Businessman from Bengal representing commercial community. Participated in economic policy discussions.

members.name: Basanta Kumar Das
members.summary: An Indian Politician belonging to the Indian National Congress and actively participated in the freedom struggle; Elected to the Lok Sabha.

members.name: Renuka Ray
members.summary: Prominent women's rights advocate. Legal secretary to the All India Women's Conference. Represented India in the U.N. General Assembly in May 1949.

members.name: H. C. Mookerjee
members.summary: Prominent Bengali Christian leader, Vice-President of Constituent Assembly.

members.name: Surendra Mohan Ghose
members.summary: Intellectual from Bengal. Contributed to constitutional theory and philosophical foundations.

members.name: Syama Prasad Mookerjee
members.summary: Distinguished legal scholar and intellectual from Bengal. Major contributor to constitutional debates on federalism, governance, and fundamental rights. Founded Bharatiya Jana Sangh post-independence.

members.name: Ari Bahadur Gurung
members.summary: Tribal representative from Bengal hill communities. Advocated for tribal rights and hill region protections.

members.name: R. E. Platel
members.summary: Anglo-Indian community representative from Bengal. Advocated for minority community rights and protections.

members.name: K. C. Neogy
members.summary: Eminent lawyer and legislator, chairperson of first Finance Commission

members.name: Raghib Ahsan
members.summary: Formed the All India Muslim Youth League and set up the Calcutta Muslim League. Prominent member of the All India Muslim League Council. Played a key role in framing Pakistan's Constitution.

members.name: Somnath Lahiri
members.summary: Communist Party representative from Bengal. Brought socialist and left-wing perspectives to constitutional debates on workers rights, property, and social justice.

members.name: Jasimuddin Ahmad
members.summary: Journalist and writer from Bengal. Brought media perspectives and cultural viewpoints to constitutional discussions.

members.name: Naziruddin Ahmad
members.summary: A prominent voice from the Muslim League within the Constituent Assembly. An influential journalist, lawyer, politician and activist from West Bengal.

members.name: Abdul Hamid
members.summary: Community leader from Bengal. Advocated for minority rights, religious freedom, and communal harmony.

members.name: Abdul Halim Ghaznavi
members.summary: A politician, zamindar, educationist, and industrialist. Member of the Central Legislative Assembly in British India.

members.name: Nibaran Chandra Laskar
members.summary: Senior Professor of Sanskrit and Bengali. Spearheaded various campaigns to abolish untouchability in Assam. Post-independence served as the Deputy Minister for Relief and Rehabilitation in Assam.

members.name: Dharanidhar Basu-Matari
members.summary: Regional administrator from Assam. Contributed to state governance provisions and federal structure.

members.name: Gopinath Bardoloi
members.summary: A politician and Indian independence activist who served as the 1st Chief Minister of Assam; the Governor of Assam, Jairamdas Daulatram, conferred the title Lokpriya or 'loved by all' on Bordoloi.

members.name: J. J. M. Nichols-Roy
members.summary: Architect of the Sixth Schedule

members.name: Kuladhar Chaliha
members.summary: First President of Assam Pradesh Congress Committee and a prominent member of the Assam Council and the Central Legislative Assembly. Former Speaker of the Assam Legislative Assembly.

members.name: Rohini Kumar Chaudhury
members.summary: Prominent figure in Assamese politics. Member of the Assam legislature between 1927 and 1945

members.name: Muhammad Saadulla
members.summary: Knighted by the British in 1928. First Premier of Assam in British India. Only Muslim League member included in the Constituent Assembly's Drafting Committee.

members.name: Abdur Rouf
members.summary: Muslim community leader from Assam. Represented regional and minority interests in constitutional framework.

members.name: Girija Shankar Guha
members.summary: Administrator from Tripura and Manipur hill states. Advocated for tribal and hill region protections.

members.name: Bishwanath Das
members.summary: Politician, philanthropist, and lawyer; former Prime Minister of Odissa.

members.name: Krishna Chandra Gajapati Narayana Dev
members.summary: Ruling prince of Orissa state. Represented royal interests in state integration and constitutional governance.

members.name: Harekrushna Mahatab
members.summary: Popularly known as 'Utkal Keshari', he was the leader of the Indian National Congress, a notable figure in the Indian independence movement, and a former Chief Minister of Odisha.

members.name: Laxminarayan Sahu
members.summary: Landlord and rural administrator from Orissa. Focused on agrarian relations and village governance.

members.name: Lokanath Mishra
members.summary: Associated with the Congress, the Swatantra Party and the Janata Party. Former Governor of Assam, Nagaland and Arunachal Pradesh.

members.name: Nandkishore Das
members.summary: Social worker from Orissa. Advocated for community welfare and social development provisions.

members.name: Rajkrishna Bose
members.summary: Lawyer from Orissa. Contributed legal expertise to constitutional framework and judicial provisions.

members.name: Santanu Kumar Das
members.summary: Educator from Orissa. Focused on education and cultural preservation for regional language and heritage.

members.name: Lal Mohan Pati
members.summary: Administrator from Orissa States. Represented state governance interests in integration discussions.

members.name: N. Madhava Rau
members.summary: Worked with several Princely States; Served as the Dewan of Mysore. Took part in the Round Table Conferences. Involved in the drafting of the Government of India Act, 1935.

members.name: Raj Kunwar
members.summary: Political leader from Orissa States. Participated in state integration and constitutional governance.

members.name: Sarangadhar Das
members.summary: Prominent leader of the All-Orissa States' Peoples' Movement that demanded a responsible government in all Princely States. Post-independence joined the Socialist Party and served as its chairman.

members.name: Yudhishthir Misra
members.summary: Scholar from Orissa States. Contributed to constitutional philosophy and governance theory.

members.name: Ambica Charan Shukla
members.summary: Lawyer from Central Provinces and Berar. Contributed legal expertise to fundamental rights and judicial provisions.

members.name: Raghu Vira
members.summary: Highly educated linguist and scholar of great repute; A Hindu-Hindi extremist and a prominent Member of the Constituent Assembly's Hindi committee tasked with translating the Constitution into Hindi.

members.name: Rajkumari Amrit Kaur
members.summary: Long time freedom fighter, Gandhi's close aide and independent India's first Minister of Health.

members.name: Bhagwantrao Mandloi
members.summary: Landlord and rural administrator representing agrarian interests from Central Provinces and Berar.

members.name: Brijlal Biyani
members.summary: A political activist and writer popularly known as 'Vidarbha Kesari'; participated in the Dahihanda Salt Satyagraha and Jungle Satyagraha.

members.name: Thakur Cheedilal
members.summary: Regional ruler from Central Provinces and Berar. Represented princely state interests in constitutional governance.

members.name: Seth Govind Das
members.summary: N/A

members.name: Hari Singh Gour
members.summary: Eminent jurist and legal scholar from Central Provinces. Major intellectual contributor to constitutional provisions on judiciary, courts, and legal framework.

members.name: Hari Vishnu Kamath
members.summary: Ex-ICS officer, social worker and freelance journalist, who joined the freedom movement under Subash Chandra Bose's Forward Bloc Party.

members.name: Hemchandra Jagobaji Khandekar
members.summary: Educator from Central Provinces. Focused on education provisions and cultural representation.

members.name: Ghanshyam Singh Gupta
members.summary: Political organizer from Central Provinces with administrative experience. Contributed to governance discussions.

members.name: Laxman Shrawan Bhatkar
members.summary: Imprisoned for taking part in the Satyagraha Movement; a member of the Scheduled Caste Federation.

members.name: Panjabrao Deshmukh
members.summary: A prominent social activist and a leader to the farmers of India who also served as the Minister of Agriculture in Jawaharlal Nehru's First Cabinet in 1952.

members.name: Ravi Shankar Shukla
members.summary: 1st Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh, politician and a strong Hindi language supporter.

members.name: R.K. Sidhwa
members.summary: Lifelong member of the Congress, becoming its General Secretary in 1932. Served as the Mayor of Karachi.

members.name: Dada Dharmadhikari
members.summary: Social reformer from Central Provinces. Advocated for social welfare and justice provisions.

members.name: Frank Anthony
members.summary: A prominent educationist and member of the Anglo-Indian community

members.name: Kazi Syed Karimuddin
members.summary: An emninent member of the Constituent Assembly of India who is also a notable litigator.

members.name: Ganpatrao Dani
members.summary: Administrator from Central Provinces. Represented regional interests in governance framework.

members.name: Ratanlal Kishorilal Malviya
members.summary: Businessman from Central Provinces States. Represented commercial and business interests.

members.name: Kishori Mohan Tripathi
members.summary: Scholar from Central Provinces States. Contributed to constitutional thought and governance.

members.name: Thakur Ramprasad Potai
members.summary: Tribal leader from Central Provinces States. Advocated for tribal rights and indigenous protections.

members.name: Vinayak Sitaram Sarwate
members.summary: Scholar and administrator from Madhya Bharat. Contributed to constitutional framework design.

members.name: Brijraj Narain
members.summary: Princely ruler from Madhya Bharat. Represented state interests in integration and governance.

members.name: Gopikrishna Vijayavargiya
members.summary: Political leader from Madhya Bharat. Participated in state integration and governance discussions.

members.name: Ram Sahai
members.summary: Administrator from Madhya Bharat with governance expertise. Focused on administrative structures.

members.name: Kusum Kant Jain
members.summary: Businessman from Madhya Bharat representing commercial interests.

members.name: Radhavallabh Vijayvargiya
members.summary: Political organizer from Madhya Bharat. Experienced in local governance and community organization.

members.name: Sitaram Jajoo
members.summary: Social welfare advocate from Madhya Bharat. Focused on development and community welfare.

members.name: Awadhesh Pratap Singh
members.summary: Politician and administrator from central India; focused on regional development and integration of princely states.

members.name: Shambu Nath Shukla
members.summary: Scholar and politician from Vindhya Pradesh; advocate for regional interests and local governance structures.

members.name: Ram Sahai Tiwary
members.summary: Administrator and legal expert from Vindhya Pradesh; worked on institutional development and democratic processes.

members.name: Manoolal Dwivedi
members.summary: Educator and politician from Vindhya Pradesh; promoted education and cultural development in central India.

members.name: Lal Singh
members.summary: Politician from Bhopal; represented central Indian interests in national governance and administrative structure.

members.name: Balchandra Maheshwar Gupte
members.summary: Congress leader from Bombay Presidency; advocate for industrial development and commercial interests of western India.

members.name: Hansa Mehta
members.summary: Women's rights activist and feminist (1890â€“1995) from Bombay; pioneering advocate for gender equality and women's education.

members.name: Hari Vinayak Pataskar
members.summary: First Union Law Minister of 1952 Lok Sabha, introduced the Hindu Code Bill; first Governor of Madhya Pradesh

members.name: Joseph Alban D'Souza
members.summary: Catholic leader and Congress politician from Bombay; advocate for minority community rights and communal harmony.

members.name: Kanayalal Nanabhai Desai
members.summary: Involved in regional politics in Gujarat; a member of the First Lok Sabha in 1952

members.name: Keshavrao Jedhe
members.summary: A strong leader of political and social reform movements in Maharashtra; founded the Peasants and Workers Party (PWP)

members.name: Khandubhai Kasanji Desai
members.summary: India's third Labour minister; founded the Indian National Trade Union Congress; active participant in trade union and labour issues

members.name: B. G. Kher
members.summary: A premier politician in Bombay; helped to establish the Poona University (now known as the Savitribai Phule Pune University)

members.name: Minoo Masani
members.summary: Eminent Parsi member of the Constituent Assembly, Represented socialist strand of Congress

members.name: K.M. Munshi
members.summary: N/A

members.name: Narahar Vishnu Gadgil
members.summary: Pioneer of various social reform movements; former Governor of Punjab; former vice-chancellor of Poona University

members.name: S. Nijalingappa
members.summary: Former Chief Minister of Karnataka; active in state politics in Karnataka

members.name: S. K. Patil
members.summary: Trade unionist and Congress leader from Bombay; strong advocate for labor rights and workers' welfare.

members.name: Ramchandra Manohar Nalavade
members.summary: Congress politician and social worker from Bombay; engaged in community service and educational initiatives.

members.name: R. R. Diwakar
members.summary: Former Governor of Bihar and first Union Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting; key figure in unification of Kannada speaking regions

members.name: Shankarrao Deo
members.summary: Congress member from Bombay; worked on agrarian issues and rural development in western India.

members.name: G. V. Mavalankar
members.summary: Known as the 'Father of Lok Sabha', he was the Speaker of the first Lok Sabha in 1952

members.name: Vallabhbhai Patel
members.summary: Iron Man and Unifier of India, Member and Chairman of key Assembly Committees

members.name: Abdul Kadar Mohammad Shaikh
members.summary: Muslim minority leader from Bombay; advocate for communal harmony and minority community representation.

members.name: Abdul Kadir Abdul Aziz Khan
members.summary: Muslim League member from Bombay; represented Muslim community perspectives during independence period.

members.name: Vinayakrao Balshankar Vaidya
members.summary: Politician from Bombay States; represented princely state interests during integration and transition to democratic governance.

members.name: B.N. Munavalli
members.summary: A lawyer and prominent freedom fighter in Ramdurg; participated in the Karnataka unification movement.

members.name: Gokulbhai Bhatt
members.summary: Known as the 'Gandhi' of Rajasthan. Fiercely advocated for decentralisation, local democracy and village panchayats in the Constituent Assembly Debates.

members.name: Jivraj Narayan Mehta
members.summary: One of the few female drafters of the Indian Constitution, and a prominent women's rights activist.

members.name: Gopaldas Ambaidas Desai
members.summary: Congress member from Bombay States; businessman and social reformer engaged in state integration process.

members.name: Paranlal Thakurlal Munshi
members.summary: Administrator and legal expert from Bombay States; worked on institutional development during state reorganization.

members.name: Balasaheb Hanumantrao Khardekar
members.summary: A passionate advocate of education and teacher; staunch advocate against prohibition of alcohol; avid cricket enthusiast

members.name: Ratnappa Kumbhar
members.summary: Representative of artisan and craftsman communities from Bombay States; advocate for traditional industries and economic development.

members.name: Bhavanji Arjan Khimji
members.summary: Long-time politician within the Indian National Congress; cotton merchant and businessman by profession

members.name: Balwantrai Mehta
members.summary: Architect of Panchayati Raj

members.name: Jaisukhlal Hathi
members.summary: Businessman and merchant from Saurashtra; represented commercial and trading community interests.

members.name: Amritlal Vithaldas Thakkar
members.summary: Saurashtra leader and advocate for regional integration; worked on regional development and governance.

members.name: Chimanlal Chakubhai Shah
members.summary: Politician and administrator from Saurashtra; focused on regional issues and democratic governance.

members.name: Samaldas Gandhi
members.summary: Congress leader from Saurashtra; involved in regional democratic transition and governance issues.

members.name: O. V. Alagesan
members.summary: Active freedom fighter; three-time Member of Parliament including Union Minister for Transport and Railways from 1952-57

members.name: Ammu Swaminathan
members.summary: A founding member of the Women's Indian Association. Former Vice President of the Federation of Film Societies and the Censor Board and President of the Bharat Scouts and Guides.

members.name: M. Ananthasayanam Ayyangar
members.summary: A scholar, a seasoned parliamentarian and a skilled lawyer; former speaker of the Lok Sabha

members.name: Moturi Satyanarayana
members.summary: Proficient linguist and active freedom fighter; inspired by Gandhi's movement to make Hindi the national language

members.name: Dakshayani Velayudhan
members.summary: Sole Female Dalit Member of Constituent Assembly

members.name: G. Durgabai
members.summary: A freedom fighter from the age of 12 and popularly known as the 'Iron Lady'; she is an important figure in the literacy movement in India, especially in education for girls.

members.name: Kala Venkatarao
members.summary: Active freedom fighter during the Independence movement; former Minister of Finance and Revenue for Andhra Pradesh upon its creation

members.name: N. Gopalaswamy Ayyangar
members.summary: Drafting Committee Member, Architect of Article 370

members.name: D. Govinda Das
members.summary: South Indian intellectual and Congress member from Madras; advocate for regional representation and Dravidian interests.

members.name: Jerome D'Souza
members.summary: First Rector in India; a prominent diplomat of the Nehru government; proficient in several languages

members.name: P. Kakkan
members.summary: Fierce advocate for the rights of Dalit people and the underprivileged; an active freedom fighter and local Congress politician

members.name: T. M. Kaliannan
members.summary: Political leader from Madras Presidency; focused on southern India's development and regional autonomy.

members.name: K. Kamaraj
members.summary: Former Chief Minister of Madras; eminent politician within the Indian National Congress; Bharat Ratna awardee in 1976

members.name: V. C. Kesava Rao
members.summary: Congress politician from Madras; advocate for southern Indian interests and regional governance.

members.name: T. T. Krishnamachari
members.summary: Economist and member of Drafting Committee who dedicated 4014 hours to Constitutional work. Later served twice as Finance Minister (1956-58, 1964-66). Pioneer in India's monetary policy and banking structure. First minister to resign due to Mundhra scandal (1958).

members.name: Alladi Krishnaswamy Iyer
members.summary: Eminent Constitutional Law Expert. Advocate-General of Madras State. Played a critical role in the Constituent Assembly and was part of nine of its Committees.

members.name: L. Krishnaswami Bharathi
members.summary: Advocate of Gandhian values and reputed Congress leader; contributed to the official language issue in the Constituent Assembly

members.name: P. Kunhiraman
members.summary: Congress member from Kerala region; worked on educational and social development in southern India.

members.name: Mosalikanti Thirumala Rao
members.summary: Agrarian reformer from Madras; strong advocate for peasant rights and agricultural development.

members.name: V. I. Munuswamy Pillai
members.summary: Tamil Nadu leader and social reformer; worked on educational advancement and community development.

members.name: M. A. Muthiah Chettiar
members.summary: Active politician in the Madras Legislative Assembly; respected banker and educationist; Padma Bhushan awardee in 1973

members.name: V. Nadimuthu Pillai
members.summary: Madras Presidency administrator and advocate for democratic principles and regional governance.

members.name: S. Nagappa
members.summary: Advocate for the rights of Dalits; architect of the famous Kurnool District Circular that guided local participation for Quit India movement

members.name: P. L. Narasimha Raju
members.summary: Congress member from Madras; worked on agricultural reform and rural development in southern India.

members.name: B. Pattabhi Sitaramayya
members.summary: Originally a doctor, he gave up practicing to join the Indian Freedom Movement; had a weekly English publication called the 'Janmabhumi.

members.name: C. Perumalswamy Reddy
members.summary: Madras-based politician; advocate for regional interests and agrarian welfare in southern India.

members.name: T. Prakasam
members.summary: Andhra Pradesh freedom fighter and political leader; prominent in independence struggle and regional politics.

members.name: S. H. Prater
members.summary: Christian scientist and naturalist from Madras; pioneer in biological research and environmental studies in India.

members.name: Raja Swetachalapati
members.summary: Aristocratic leader from Madras; represented traditional princely class interests in governance transition.

members.name: R. K. Shanmukham Chetty
members.summary: India's first Finance Minister; advocate for Dalit rights and the Tamil language; former Vice-Chancellor of Annamalai University

members.name: T. A. Ramalingam Chettiar
members.summary: Prominent merchant and Chettiar community leader from Madras; advocate for business and trading community interests.

members.name: Ramnath Goenka
members.summary: Founder of the Indian Express; an advocate for free speech and freedom of press; inspired to join the Freedom Struggle because of Gandhi

members.name: O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar
members.summary: First Chief Minister of Madras after independence. The Madras Temple Entry Authorisation Act and the Tamil Nadu Devadasis (Prevention of Dedication) were passed in 1947 under his leadership.

members.name: N. G. Ranga
members.summary: Strong advocate for farmers' rights; founder of All India Kisan Congress; co-founder of the Swatantra Party

members.name: Neelam Sanjeeva Reddy
members.summary: Reputed politician in Andhra Pradesh; former speaker of the Lok Sabha and youngest President to be elected

members.name: Sheik Galib Sahib
members.summary: Muslim community leader from Madras; advocate for minority rights and communal harmony in southern India.

members.name: K. Santhanam
members.summary: Former editor of the Indian Express and the Hindustan Times. Chairman of the Committee on Prevention of Corruption, which eventually set up the Central Vigilance Commission in 1964

members.name: B. Shiva Rao
members.summary: Prominent journalist and interlocutor; compiled 6 volumes on Constituent Assembly debates and documents

members.name: Kallur Subba Rao
members.summary: Padma Shri awardee in 1967; a gifted orator and nationalist; former Deputy Speaker of the Andhra Assembly

members.name: U. Srinivas Mallya
members.summary: Congress politician from Madras; engaged in social reform and community development in southern India.

members.name: P. Subbarayan
members.summary: Advocate for language rights and Dalit issues; former Governor of Maharashtra and member of first Rajya Sabha

members.name: C. Subramaniam
members.summary: Former Agriculture Minister; Bharat Ratna awardee in 1998.

members.name: Vinnakota Jagannatha Gupta
members.summary: Madras-based administrator; worked on regional development and governance issues in southern India.

members.name: V. Subramaniam
members.summary: Tamil Nadu Congress member; engaged in educational and social development initiatives in southern India.

members.name: M. C. Veerabahu Pillai
members.summary: Madras administrator and social reformer; worked on educational advancement and community welfare.

members.name: P. M. Velayudapan
members.summary: Kerala leader and social worker; engaged in educational and economic development in southern India.

members.name: A. K. Menon
members.summary: Congress member from Madras; worked on regional development and social reform initiatives.

members.name: T. J. M. Wilson
members.summary: Christian community leader from Madras; advocate for minority community rights and welfare.

members.name: M. Muhammad Ismail
members.summary: Founded the Indian Union Muslim League party in 1948; one of the 28 Muslim League members in the Constituent Assembly

members.name: K. T. M. Ahmed Ibrahim
members.summary: Muslim community leader from Madras; advocate for communal harmony and minority representation.

members.name: Mahboob Ali Baig Sahib Bahadur
members.summary: Aristocratic Muslim leader from Madras; represented princely class and minority community interests.

members.name: B. Pocker Sahib Bahadur
members.summary: Eminent Muslim League leader, Founding member of the Kerala Muslim Educational Association

members.name: V. Ramaiah
members.summary: Administrator from Madras States; worked on state reorganization and democratic governance transition.

members.name: Ramakrishna Ranga Rao
members.summary: Congress politician from Madras; engaged in social reform and agricultural development.

members.name: V Kodandarama Reddy
members.summary: Madras administrator; focused on regional governance and administrative development in southern India.

members.name: P.Ranga Reddy
members.summary: Regional administrator and civil servant from Madras Presidency; involved in land administration and revenue management during state reorganization period.

members.name: D.Sanjeevaiyaa
members.summary: Administrator and public servant from Madras Presidency; worked on governance structures and administrative development in southern India during transition to democratic rule.

members.name: V. Ramaiah
members.summary: Administrator from Madras States; worked on state reorganization and democratic governance transition.

members.name: C. M. Poonacha
members.summary: A former Chief Minister of Coorg and a Minister in the State of Mysore; actively participated in the Freedom Movement and the Salt Satyagraha.

members.name: K. Chengalaraya Reddy
members.summary: Mysore State administrator; worked on state integration and democratic transition processes.

members.name: T. Siddalingayya
members.summary: Congress member from Mysore; engaged in educational and social development in southern India.

members.name: H. R. Guruv Reddy
members.summary: Mysore State politician; worked on regional governance and administrative matters.

members.name: S. V. Krishnamoorthy Rao
members.summary: An eminent politician and a freedom fighter who was elected as a member of the Indian National Congress.

members.name: Kengal Hanumanthaiah
members.summary: First chief Minister of Mysore State

members.name: H. Siddhaveerappa
members.summary: Congress leader from Mysore; involved in state integration and democratic governance development.

members.name: T. Channiah
members.summary: Mysore State administrator; worked on state reorganization and transition to democratic rule.

members.name: Pattom A. Thanu Pillai
members.summary: Began as a lawyer but later abandoned legal practice and joined politics to protest police brutality and British. First prime minister of Travancore's newly democratic government.

members.name: R. Sankar
members.summary: Third Chief Minister of Kerala; lawyer, educationist, and an advocate for progressive ideas.

members.name: P. T. Chacko
members.summary: A Congress party stalwart from Kerala. Pushed for self-governance in the Travancore State. After independence, held the ministries of Home Affairs, Law, and Revenue in Kerala.

members.name: Panampilly Govinda Menon
members.summary: Served as the Chief Minister of both the Cochin and the merged Cochin-Travancore State. Held important ministerial posts including in the Food, Agriculture, Railways, Law and Social Welfare departments.

members.name: Annie Mascarene
members.summary: Served as the Minister in charge of Health and Power in the 1948 Travancore-Cochin Legislative Assembly. First woman from Kerala to serve as a Member of the Parliament of India.

members.name: P. S. Nataraja Pillai
members.summary: Associated with multiple political parties including the Congress, the Indian Socialist Party and the Praja Socialist Party. Repeat legislator from the Travancore-Cochin Legislative Assembly.

members.name: K.A. Mohamed
members.summary: Representative from Travancore-Cochin; engaged in interfaith dialogue and community organization in Kerala region.

members.name: P.K.Lekshmanan
members.summary: Leader from Travancore-Cochin; worked on regional integration and administrative arrangements during Kerala's formation as a democratic state.

members.name: A. Ramaswamy Mudaliar
members.summary: A Lawyer, diplomat, and statesman who was the first president of the United Nations Economic and Social Council. The 24th and the last Dewan of Mysore.

members.name: Asaf Ali
members.summary: Noted lawyer who defended revolutionaries like Bhagat Singh in their court trials. An important statesman post-independence; Served as the Indian Ambassador to U.S.A and Switzerland.

members.name: C. Rajagopalachari
members.summary: Popularly referred to as 'Rajaji', a prominent Indian statesman who was a firm Gandhian and a member of the Indian National Congress.

members.name: Deep Narayan Singh
members.summary: An Indian politician who entered the freedom fight in response to Gandhi's call for Civil Disobedience, and a former Chief Minister of Bihar.

members.name: Diwan Chaman Lall
members.province: Patiala and East Punjab States Union
members.summary: Lawyer and journalist; one of the most influential leaders in organising workers' rights movements and voicing the concerns of the labour class in India.

members.name: Himmatsinhji M. K.
members.summary: Was a part of the Constituent Assembly, but not much is known about his involvement in the Indian independence movement.

members.name: K.M. Panikkar
members.province: Patiala and East Punjab States Union
members.summary: N/A

members.name: Kailash Nath Katju
members.summary: Prominent lawyer during Independence who fought cases for political prisoners; also involved in educationl and journalistic endeavours

members.name: Khan Abdul Gaffar Khan
members.summary: A political and spiritual leader known popularly as Frontier Gandhi, and a lifelong advocate of Hindu-Muslim unity.

members.name: Kiran Sankar Roy
members.summary: Prominent leader of Bengal Congress. Briefly joined the Swaraj Party and served as its Secretary. Taught History at Presidency and Sanskrit College, Calcutta.

members.name: Leela Roy
members.summary: A fierce-spirited and strongly opinionated female member of the Constituent Assembly who was also a staunch feminist who worked by her women empowerment motive.

members.name: M. R. Jayakar
members.summary: First Vice-Chancellor of the University of Poona; eminent jurist and lawyer from Bombay; key member of Hindu Mahasabha

members.name: M. V. Rama Rao
members.summary: Veteran Congress Party member from the erstwhile State of Mysore. Post-independence, he held important cabinet positions in the State including that of Home Minister and Law Minister.

members.name: Malati Choudhury
members.summary: A staunch Marxist influenced by Tagore's ideas. Worked towards rural development, tribal welfare and abolition of the zamindari system in Orissa. Imprisoned during the 1975 emergency.

members.name: Narayan Bhaskar Khare
members.summary: First Premier of the erstwhile State of Central Provinces and Berar; Prime Minister of the former Alwar State. Initially with the Congress, later joined the Hindu Mahasabha.

members.name: Prafulla Chandra Ghosh
members.summary: West Bengal's first chief minister. Initially with the Congress but later formed a new party - Progressive Democratic Front. Received a doctorate in chemistry.

members.name: Pramatha Ranjan Thakur
members.summary: Prominent political and spiritual leader, who headed the Matua Mahasangha sect. Established the Bengal chapter of the Depressed Classes League. Served as a Minister (State) in the Tribal Welfare Department but resigned in 1964.

members.name: Raj Bahadur
members.summary: Associated with Hindustan Socialist Republican Army and the Bharatpur Praja Parishad Party. Held several ministerial positions after independence.

members.name: Sarat Chandra Bose
members.summary: Socialist republican; founded the Socialist Republican Party in 1947; active revolutionary

members.name: Sarojini Naidu
members.summary: Renowned poet and author. First Indian woman President of the Indian National Congress. Championed the cause of women's suffrage and the improved conditions of widows in India.

members.name: Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan
members.summary: Second President of India. Prolific writer, scholar and educationist. Seasoned diplomat representing India at the UN.
